results.definition: fraught with extreme danger; nearly hopeless
examples: on all fronts the Allies were in a desperate situation due to lack of materiel

results.definition: arising from or marked by despair or loss of hope
examples: helpless and desperate--as if at the end of his tether

results.definition: showing extreme courage; especially of actions courageously undertaken in desperation as a last resort
examples: made a last desperate attempt to reach the climber
the desperate gallantry of our naval task forces marked the turning point in the Pacific war

results.definition: a person who is frightened and in need of help
examples: they prey on the hopes of the desperate

results.definition: (of persons) dangerously reckless or violent as from urgency or despair
showing extreme urgency or intensity especially because of great need or desire
examples: felt a desperate urge to confess
